title: forge build fails when contract pragma >=0.8.15
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (2457e5f 2022-06-16T00:04:29.19997Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

forge build

### Operating System

macOS (Intel)

### Describe the bug

running `forge build` fails if the contract pragma is 0.8.15

example:
```solidity
// SPDX-License-Identifier: UNLICENSED
pragma solidity ^0.8.15;

contract Contract {}
```

debug output:
```shell
[⠃] Compiling...2022-06-16T11:16:11.692503Z ERROR ethers_solc::resolver: failed to resolve versions
[⠊] Compiling...
[⠒] Unable to resolve import: "forge-std/Script.sol" with remappings:
        src/=/Users/sbacha/latest-sol/src/
        script/=/Users/sbacha/latest-sol/script/
Error:
   0: Discovered incompatible solidity versions in following
      : script/Contract.s.sol (^0.8.13) imports:
          src/Contract.sol (^0.8.15)
      Discovered incompatible solidity versions in following
      : src/Contract.sol (^0.8.15) imports:

Location:
   cli/src/compile.rs:100

  ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━ BACKTRACE ━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━━
   1: __mh_execute_header<unknown>
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
   2: __mh_execute_header<unknown>
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
   3: __mh_execute_header<unknown>
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
   4: __mh_execute_header<unknown>
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
   5: __mh_execute_header<unknown>
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
   6: __mh_execute_header<unknown>
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
   7: __mh_execute_header<unknown>
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
   8: __mh_execute_header<unknown>
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
   9: __mh_execute_header<unknown>
      at <unknown source file>:<unknown line>
```

additionally here is a reproduction repo

https://github.com/sambacha/foundry-build-bug/pull/1


disabling auto-detect and removing remappings and script as a config field let it build
https://github.com/sambacha/foundry-build-bug/pull/3/commits/1ef999eb3603ca13d040d353ea0b6c2e53975bc7#diff-bac743fe3d899998e32393af53af8cc7d28c89c3d7fabfa48b01361cf8d42d9bR2-L38

note, that ^0.8.13 pragma version is compatible to the compiler directive of having ^0.8.15, >=0.8.15, ~0.8.15

![963f3c42a12513c03a0ad95265710456](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/706218/174105819-350376b4-bc0e-4e82-8465-a52f15bb9ddb.png)

Same here, did `foundryup` before.

> ![963f3c42a12513c03a0ad95265710456](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/706218/174105819-350376b4-bc0e-4e82-8465-a52f15bb9ddb.png)
> 
> 
> 
> Same here, did `foundryup` before.

I am not getting a checksum error , this is new
still an intermittent issue with the latest binary

We're getting the releases from solc's own list on platforms they support, so the issue seems to be upstream? cc @mattsse 

Edit: https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/issues/2003#issuecomment-1158234632

can't reproduce this on today's nightly and intel mac

can you try removing rm -rf ~/.svm/0.8.15 ?

> We're getting the releases from solc's own list on platforms they support, so the issue seems to be upstream? cc @mattsse 
> 
> 
> 
> Edit: https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/issues/2003#issuecomment-1158234632

The solidity binary server does have intermittent outages, i have a cache proxy for our CI because of this

> can't reproduce this on today's nightly and intel mac
> 
> 
> 
> can you try removing rm -rf ~/.svm/0.8.15 ?   

Will check soon 🙏 thx

I'm getting a similar error, but on a fresh install of forge.

```
❯ forge build
[⠊] Compiling...
[⠃] installing solc version "0.8.15"
[⠊] Failed to install solc 0.8.15: Checksum mismatch for version 0.8.15
Error: 
   0: Checksum mismatch for version 0.8.15
```
what's your OS and build?
intel or apple silicon?
apple silicon
@roynalnaruto looks like we have some issue with the newest M1 native release
Status on this?

> Status on this?

working wrt intel latest release

two issues fixed since this was opened
* 0.8.15 baked in
* fixed incorrect apple silicon native builds

so closing this

What's the fix for this? I just got this on a Mac Intel with build `forge 0.2.0 (f016135 2022-07-04T00:15:02.930499Z)`

fwiw I am trying to `forge build` the [`hello_foundry` example](https://book.getfoundry.sh/getting-started/first-steps.html)

this should have been resolved, 

can you try again after nuking: `rm -rf ~/.svm/0.8.15`

still fails :/ 

```
➜  hello_foundry (master) ✗ forge --version
forge 0.2.0 (f016135 2022-07-04T00:15:02.930499Z)
➜  hello_foundry (master) ✗ pwd
/Users/damontucker/workspace/git/hello_foundry
➜  hello_foundry (master) ✗ ls
foundry.toml script       src          test
➜  hello_foundry (master) ✗ rm -rf ~/.svm/0.8.15
➜  hello_foundry (master) ✗ forge build
[⠊] Compiling...
[⠒] Unable to resolve import: "forge-std/Script.sol" with remappings:
        src/=/Users/damontucker/workspace/git/hello_foundry/src/
        test/=/Users/damontucker/workspace/git/hello_foundry/test/
        script/=/Users/damontucker/workspace/git/hello_foundry/script/
[⠢] Unable to resolve import: "forge-std/Test.sol" with remappings:
        src/=/Users/damontucker/workspace/git/hello_foundry/src/
        test/=/Users/damontucker/workspace/git/hello_foundry/test/
        script/=/Users/damontucker/workspace/git/hello_foundry/script/
[⠘] installing solc version "0.8.15"
[⠊] Successfully installed solc 0.8.15
[⠒] Compiling 3 files with 0.8.15
[⠢] Solc 0.8.15 finished in 13.83ms
Error:
Compiler run failed
error[6275]: ParserError: Source "forge-std/Script.sol" not found: File not found. Searched the following locations: "/Users/damontucker/workspace/git/hello_foundry".
 --> script/Contract.s.sol:4:1:
  |
4 | import "forge-std/Script.sol";
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^



error[6275]: ParserError: Source "forge-std/Test.sol" not found: File not found. Searched the following locations: "/Users/baizele/workspace/git/hello_foundry".
 --> test/Contract.t.sol:4:1:
  |
4 | import "forge-std/Test.sol";
  | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^



➜  hello_foundry (master) ✗
```
you're liking missing the dependency

Worked after I did that. Thanks!

Created a pr to add this step: https://github.com/foundry-rs/book/pull/422

Closed that above pr as I figured out why it wasn't working for me.

Turns out I have a local git defender check that interferes with forge-std being built. Once I set up the git defender, I was able to successfully install with `forge init hello_foundry --force --no-commit`
You saved me @ebaizel 🙇🏼 thanks alot

forge script \
> broadcast

with remappings:

 --> script/SolveTutorial.sol:3:1:
  |
3 | import {Script} from "forge-std/Script.sol";
